name: Discoshare
author: Ammari Nader

sections.description:
​ Discoshare is a WooCommerce plugin that allows you to increase your revenue with a very smart way. Built to integrate seamlessly with WordPress and WooCommerce, Discoshare is the world’s favorite marketing solution that turn every sale into an Instagram photo. ​ At Discoshare, we think every Instagram pic of your stuff has the potential to drive sales. We’re here to help you amp up that revenue on your good looks alone. ​ How it works ? ​ 1) You sell
When a customer makes a purchase, we email them an exclusive discount for more of your products if they post a picture of their most recent purchase on Instagram. ​ 2) They share The customer is already madly in love with your products, so they immediately share a photo of their latest buy on Instagram. ​ 3) They come back
Our platform picks up the latest post of your products and immediately sends the customer the promised discount, which they’ll use to buy more from you. ​ ​
sections.installation:
​ ​ ​

Automatic installation

​ Automatic installation is the easiest option as WordPress handles the file transfers itself and you don’t need to leave your web browser. To do an automatic install of WooCommerce, log in to your WordPress dashboard, navigate to the Plugins menu and click Add New. ​ In the search field type “Discoshare” and click Search Plugins. Once you’ve found our plugin you can view details about it such as the point release, rating and description. Most importantly of course, you can install it by simply clicking “Install Now”. ​

Manual installation

​ The manual installation method involves downloading our eCommerce plugin and uploading it to your web server via your favourite FTP application. The WordPress codex contains instructions on how to do this here. ​

Updating

​ Automatic updates should work like a charm, as always though, ensure you backup your site just in case. ​ If on the off-chance you do encounter issues with the shop/category pages after an update you simply need to flush the permalink by going to WordPress > Settings > Permalinks and hitting ‘save’. That should return things to normal. ​

Minimum Requirements

​ * WordPress 3.0.1 or greater * PHP version 5.2.4 or greater * PHP-CURL
* MySQL version 5.0 or greater * WooCommerce
​ ​
